pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:0.5: 45. The training rule on sitting down in private
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:1.1: On one occasion when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:1.2: Venerable Upananda the Sakyan went to the house of a friend and sat down in private alone with his wife.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:1.3: The husband complained and criticized him,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:1.4: “How could Venerable Upananda sit down in private alone with my wife?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:1.5: The monks heard the complaints of that man,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:1.6: and the monks of few desires complained and criticized Upananda,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:1.7: “How could Venerable Upananda sit down in private alone with a woman?” …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:1.8: “Is it true, Upananda, that you did this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:1.11: “Foolish man, how could you do this?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:1.13: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:1.14.1: ‘If a monk sits down in private alone with a woman, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:2.1.4: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:2.1.6: a human female, not a female spirit, not a female ghost, not a female animal. She understands and is capable of discerning bad speech and good speech, what is decent and what is indecent.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:2.1.10: just the monk and the woman.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:2.1.12: there is private to the eye and there is private to the ear.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:2.1.14: one is unable to see them winking, raising an eyebrow, or nodding.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:2.1.16: one is unable to hear ordinary speech.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:2.1.18: if the monk sits down or lies down next to the seated woman, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:2.1.19: If the woman sits down or lies down next to the seated monk, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:2.1.20: If both are seated or both are lying down, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:2.2.1: If it is a woman, and he perceives her as such, and he sits down in private alone with her, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:2.2.2: If it is a woman, but he is unsure of it, and he sits down in private alone with her, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:2.2.3: If it is a woman, but he does not perceive her as such, and he sits down in private alone with her, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:2.2.4: If he sits down in private alone with a female spirit, with a female ghost, with a _paṇḍaka_, or with a female animal in the form of a woman, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:2.2.5: If it is not a woman, but he perceives them as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:2.2.6: If it is not a woman, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:2.2.7: If it is not a woman, and he does not perceive them as such, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:2.3.2: if he has a male companion who understands;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:2.3.3: if he stands and does not sit down;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:2.3.4: if he is not seeking privacy;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:2.3.5: if he sits down preoccupied with something else;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:2.3.7: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc45:2.3.8: The training rule on sitting in private, the fifth, is finished.
